title: heap-buffer-overflow (read outside of buffer) in Sass::Prelexer::exactly<(char)92>(char const*) - libsass/src/lexer.hpp:92
content:
Built with afl-clang-fast from git source 5909ba5.
Feeding a file that contains nothing but '\ to sassc triggers this flaw.
Code 37.16 KiB
1==22006==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x60200000ef93 at pc 0x000000907c6a bp 0x7fff656d9430 sp 0x7fff656d9428

60SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow /home/geeknik/libsass/src/lexer.hpp:92 char const* Sass::Prelexer::exactly<(char)92>(char const*)
steps: Create a file containing just the backslash character: '\'
Feed this file to the sassc compiler
vuln_description: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability in libsass occurs when processing a malformed input file containing just a backslash character. The vulnerability is triggered in the Sass::Prelexer::exactly function when it attempts to read beyond the allocated buffer bounds.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to trigger with a simple malformed input, requiring no complex interactions or state manipulation. The issue is localized to a single buffer read operation without proper bounds checking.
